suppress.notes: As this vulnerability is due to string input and this service will be run locally with no outside requests, this vulnerability is not applicable file name: Handlebars.Net.Helpers.dll

As this vulnerability is due to string input and this service will be run locally with no outside requests, this vulnerability is not applicable file name: Handlebars.Net.Helpers.dll file name: System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates:4.3.0
Not applicable for our use file name: NJsonSchema.Extensions.dll

As this vulnerability is due to string input and json has an integer overflow and out-of-bounds write via a large JSON file,Buffer overflow allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors.
False positive, vulnerability is for package "wire" not wire mock file name: WireMock.Net.dll,WireMock.Org.Abstractions.dll,WireMock.Org.Abstractions.dll
False positive, vulnerability is for package "wire" not wire mock file name: WireMock.Org.Abstractions.dll
.NET Framework Information Disclosure Vulnerability file name: Microsoft.CSharp:4.3.0
file name: System.Runtime.InteropServices.dll These vunerabilities are in reference to Drupal, which we do not use

file name: GraphQL.NewtonsoftJson.dll Newtonsoft.Json before version 13.0.1 is affected by a mishandling of exceptional conditions vulnerability.Depending on the usage of the library, an unauthenticated and remote attacker may be able to cause the denial of service condition
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll Vunerability due to permissions on VoiceCommandActivity application component, no applicable.
file name: Azure.Identity:1.12.0 Applies to Azure.Identity < 1.10.2
file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll CVE-2023-44487 applies to .NET < 6.0.23 CVE-2023-36558 applies to .NET < 6.0.25
file name: Various Azure. Refers to Azure CLI.

file name: Serilog.Sinks.Async.dll A vulnerability exists in Async through 3.2.1 (fixed in 3.2.2) , which could let a malicious user obtain privileges via the mapValues() method. This is a false positive as the vulnerability exists in a NPM Javascript package named 'Async' and not the nuget .NET package named 'Serilog.Sinks.Async'.
file name: Serilog.Extensions.Logging.File.dll False positive - applies to LINE for Android and iOS.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/176 for full MS Details on CVE. A remote code execution vulnerability exists when parsing certain types of graphics files. This vulnerability only exists on systems running on MacOS or Linux. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.405, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8409 for details on this CVE. Note: This was reanalysed by NIST on 4th October, and is now a breaking issue. Affects .NET Core 2.1 - now on .NET 8 so false positive. See https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-us/vulnerability/CVE-2018-8409
file name: Azure.Core.dll .This vulnerability observed due to Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
